caption.title: Change in attainable yield from the reference period to 2041–2059 and 2081–2099.
caption.p: Maps show percentage changes in attainable yield for for maize ( a, b), wheat ( d, e) and rice ( g, h). Areas where yields change by 10% or less are marked in magenta. Areas with no present-day climate analogue are marked in grey (very few grid-cells). Yield changes are only shown for grid-cells which have a present-day climate analogue within the current harvested area of each crop, and where the current area devoted to that crop within the grid-cell exceeds 1,000 ha (ref. 35). Panels c, f and i show how the distribution of attainable yields at the grid-cell level is projected to evolve between the reference period (magenta line) and end-of-century (red line). Loss of area under the probability density curves is equivalent to the number of grid-cells for which no valid climate analogue can be found. Present-day attainable yields are obtained from ref. 4.
